Description: Lower half of a steel grey hematite cylinder seal; a figure in a robe which leaves one leg bare faces a king (?) with a mace who rests one foot on a fallen enemy and holds a mace in his left hand. Behind him stands the suppliant goddess; broken and ground down so that one end is almost square.
Bibliographic references: Collon 1986a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals III: Isin-Larsa and Old Babylonian Periods (425)
Condition: Incomplete: only the lower part survives; broken and ground down so that one end is almost square.
Acquisition name: Donated by: James Ludovic Lindsay, 26th Earl of Crawford (K.T?)
Acquisition notes: Said to have been acquired in Egypt.
